acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.00328mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the absence of mortality at the highest dose of 2,000mg/kg observed in the dermal studies with rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.33mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 245mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and rapidly degrading and bio-accumulation were unknown, it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 101.1-102.4degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutagenicity tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells(Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990))

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of reproductive toxicity and teratogenicity in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990))

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)): "The substance is a mild eye irritant with reversible effects."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)): Non-irritating to the skin.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests using the Maximization method: "Caused mild to moderate sensitization" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat repeated dose toxicity studies, increased red blood cell counts/volume, increased hemoglobin levels, high platelet counts, and slight hepatocellular hypertrophy were detected (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)). In dogs, increased urea levels, increased relative liver weight, decreased glycogen in hepatocytes, and cytoplasmic vacuolization of the renal medulla were found. These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including  "soft feces," "eyelid closure," "reduced activity," "laboured breathing" and "lacrimation" were found (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
